title: test3

title: Need direct link for admin panel in React js App
content: For now everything's fine. Problem starts in next step when I use gradle-release plugin. It detects that gradle-wrapper.properties has been changed, and commits that back into my repository. I don't want that, since when i fetch this change and try to run build locally, it fails since locally I don't have access to repository I used in Jenkins. Can you suggest a way to handle this situation properly?

title: Need direct link for admin panel in React js App
content: My app is opening with base url fine. like https://mentorlogix.com/pricebuilder/ I created a sapreat link for admin panel https://mentorlogix.com/pricebuilder/adminlogin but when I open this directly then display Page not found. But If I open this link internally from opened app then working fine. I defined these link in my router too.

title: Cloud Service
content: I think we should switch to Firebase cloud service. It is very powerful and efficient.

title: Need direct link for admin panel in React js App
content: For now everything's fine. Problem starts in next step when I use gradle-release plugin. It detects that gradle-wrapper.properties has been changed, and commits that back into my repository. I don't want that, since when i fetch this change and try to run build locally, it fails since locally I don't have access to repository I used in Jenkins. Can you suggest a way to handle this situation properly? How to use different distributionUrl for local development and Jenkins pipelines? In Maven I would just use profiles and that would fix my problem, but i'm relatively new to Gradle and i'm not really able to come to a satisfactory solution.
